sound¶

sound.player¶

class sound.player.Player(live=True)[source]¶

Sound provider for an instrument simulator.

Parameters:live (bool) – if the notes should be played immediately when added.
play_notes(notes)[source]¶

Add a note or a list of notes to the player :param notes: can be a note(int/str/Note) or notes(list of int, NoteContainer)

from sound import Player, GuitarNote
p = Player()
p.play_notes(48)                # play C-4
p.play_notes('C-4')             # play C-4
p.play_notes(GuitarNote(1, 1))  # play fret 1 on string 1
G_chord = [GuitarNote(1, 3), GuitarNote(2, 0), GuitarNote(3, 0),                    GuitarNote(4, 0), GuitarNote(5, 2), GuitarNote(6, 3)]
p.play_notes(G_chord)

sound.guitar¶

class sound.guitar.GuitarNote(string, fret)[source]¶

Bases: mingus.containers.note.Note

Represent a note on guitar.

Parameters:
  • string (int) – the number of the string, from the thinnest(1) to the thickest(6)
  • fret (int) – the fret(0-14)
open_string_notes = {1: 52, 2: 47, 3: 43, 4: 38, 5: 33, 6: 28}¶
class sound.guitar.Guitar(player)[source]¶

Bases: object

A guitar simulator.

Parameters:player – a Player instance which should have play_notes() method.
chord_dict = {'Em': [(1, 0), (2, 0), (3, 0), (4, 2), (5, 2), (6, 0)], 'C': [(1, 0), (2, 1), (3, 0), (4, 2), (5, 3)], 'D': [(1, 2), (2, 3), (3, 2), (4, 0)], 'G': [(1, 3), (2, 0), (3, 0), (4, 0), (5, 2), (6, 3)], 'D7': [(1, 2), (2, 1), (3, 2), (4, 0)], 'Bm': [(1, 2), (2, 3), (3, 4), (4, 4), (5, 2)], 'Am': [(1, 0), (2, 1), (3, 2), (4, 2), (5, 0)], 'Em7': [(1, 0), (2, 3), (3, 0), (4, 2), (5, 2), (6, 0)]}¶
reset()[source]¶

Release the left hand.

set_string(string, fret)[source]¶

Press down a fret on a string.

Parameters:
  • string (int) – the number of the string (1~6)
  • fret (int) – the number of the fret (-1~14). -1 for mute. 0 for open.
set_chord(chord_name)[source]¶

Press a chord on the guitar.

Note: all previously set states will be discarded.

Parameters:chord_name (str) – name of the chord
play_string(string)[source]¶

Play a specific string
